alert.note: Alert for Chukchi Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 17 at 5:44PM AKST until January 18 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Visibility one quarter mile or less. North winds gusting to 45 mph. Wind chills to 35 below. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast north of Kivalina. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Snow and blowing snow is causing white out conditions. Wind chills to 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds combined with snow and blowing snow are causing whiteout conditions at Point Hope late this afternoon. These conditions are expected to continue through late this evening, then improve after midnight tonight as winds decrease. Conditions are much less severe from Kivalina south.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are occuring. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult.
